name: Park Hyatt Toronto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fantastic in and of itself but the highlight was the front desk clerk Tony Valoroso. Was probably, hands down, the best staff member I've ever b\met in a hotel (and I've stayed in a lot of hotels). Upgraded the room and bent over backwards with every request.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service/staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Hyatt in July for a wedding. Without question, the rates can be pricey but the service and location are outstanding. If you look for deals you can find rates under $200/night.
reviews.title: Remarkable Service and Quality Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION:
reviews.title: First Class Hotel in a First Class Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is within walking distance to the wonderfully chic Yorkville neighborhood, the Royal Ontario Museum and the University of Toronto. If you are in the mood to walk it is also within walking distance to the CN Tower and West Queen - but it would be better to take a metro to those locations.
reviews.title: Best Sleep Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS:
reviews.title: great hotel to stay in toronto

reviews.text: August was my second stay at the Hyatt in recent years. The hotel itself and its amenities are fantastic. I stayed in the newer tower and the rooms were spacious, clean and the showers were excellent. The Roof Lounge is phenomenal.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, staff can be iffy
One of the best
reviews.text: Despite all this, both stays have involved staff being confrontational, rude and downright hostile. For the most part, the staff is as good as every other aspect of the hotel, but I find it more than simply coincidence that I have had two separate incidents with the staff.

The most recent incident was simply astonishing. My party and I were running late for a particular event that was integral to our stay in the city when our elevator became stuck between floors. After requesting help through the intercom and receiving a brief response, we were left without any contact for approx. 10-15 minutes while we became increasingly more anxious. Finally, we were able to open the doors ourselves. Remembering that most elevators have a safety feature that will not allow the elevator to move while the doors are open, we simply exited and dropped 3 feet to the next floor.
reviews.title: excellent business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the way out of the building, we were met by a hostile security guard. Rather than apologizing for our delay and lack of contact or assistance, he proceeded to insult and scold us for exiting the elevator in plain view of other guests, further delaying us while we stood in shock at this display. I could understand his position that we could have been hurt, but the onus was on him to provide assistance and instruction. This is simply unacceptable behavior inside of a supposed 5-star hotel and put a damper on what was otherwise an enjoyable stay. Being called "stupid", amongst other adjectives, is certainly not part my idea of a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, fantastic views, comfy beds!

reviews.text: All that said, I look forward to staying at the Park Hyatt again. Hopefully any further misunderstandings with staff will be avoided.
reviews.title: Old School 5 Star Excellence

reviews.text: I am a huge fan of Park Hyatts and while the Toronto facility is really good, it is a little short of their most memorable properties. First for the FYI's:
reviews.title: A Few FYI's on the Park Hyatt...Very Good But Short of Amazing

reviews.text: 1. Some rooms have benefitted have a recent recarpet and some have not, so I'd request a fresher room. My first room had not been recarpeted and while the room was acceptable, it felt tired. The recarpeted rooms are much more pleasant.
reviews.title: Luxury stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. If you are a light sleeper, exterior noise can be an issue, especially on weekends if you are on a lower floor and facing Avenue Road. Yorkville obviously draws young ultra-affluents and they enjoy playing with their Ferraris and Cayenne Turbos when they leave the clubs, resulting in loud and throaty exhaust notes penetrating some rooms. Highest floors furthest away from Bloor Street or Avenue Road are quietest.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in Yorkville
Very Rude Manager, Tatiana!
reviews.text: 3. The hotel's complimentary bicycle valet program is an excellent amenity and the Don Valley Trails and Toronto Islands make excellent destinations for riders, as does the downtown core on weekends when traffic is quite light.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've made more than 20 trips to Toronto and love both the city and area surrounding the hotel, and I agree with the general tone of the reviews. I found the level of service to be absolutely outstanding, although I didn't find the property to harmonize well in visual terms. In going from my room to breakfast for example, the room had one theme, the hallway another, the ground lobby a third, and the breakfast room yet a fourth, with none of them top-of-class or particularly complementary. A small thing for sure, but a primary reason I found it just a tad short of expectations as a past Park Hyatt guest.
reviews.title: Impeccable service, great rooms..

reviews.text: Just completed a multiple night stay at the Park Hyatt. Booked a AAA rate for a Park Suite. The hotel is located in an older building, though it has been renovated. The Park Suite was a real suite but the bedroom was narrow and only fit a queen sized bed. As the building is older, the windows are smaller and gave the appearance of a relatively dark room. The room is well maintained, with more traditional looking furniture. It is not like any Asian Park Hyatt (ie Tokyo, Seoul).
reviews.title: Professional Service and a more traditional hotel than Asian Park Hyatts

reviews.text: Service was professional, though a few minor inconveniences were noted (ie. housekeeping done fairly late in the afternoon, no newspapers delivered during the stay).
reviews.title: Year after year, a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness room is located in the basement spa and was well equipped and not that busy. You have to pass through the spa to get to the gym.
reviews.title: Park Past its Prime

reviews.text: They have complimentary car service, but it is best to book in advance. And it has limited hours of operation.
reviews.title: A Good Choice

reviews.text: Also, location is in Yorkville. Some people may prefer this location as there are lots of shops and restaurants. But it is realistically a 20 minute walk to the CBD and a $10 cab ride.
reviews.title: Great ROM location, not a five-star

description: Park Hyatt Toronto is perfectly situated in the heart of Yorkville, surrounded by over 700 upscale shops, exclusive restaurants and unique galleries. Located just minutes to the financial and entertainment districts, this luxury hotel offers convenient access to the best of Toronto attractions, including the AGO, CN Tower and Casa Loma. Within minutes of your arrival, you will be embraced by warm, residential accommodations and luxury amenities. Unwind in our incomparable 10,000-square-foot Stillwater Spa. Delight in upscale shopping escapades or museums, or settle into any of our premier dining experiences, such as Annona Restaurant or Morton's, The Steakhouse. Then retreat to our legendary Rooftop Lounge with panoramic views of the city. With its state-of-the-art conveniences and personalized service, Park Hyatt Toronto is an ideal choice for both business and leisure travelers. Come discover why today.
